intro: Schwenckia hirta, commonly known as the hairy schwenckia, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense, spherical clusters that bloom in late summer. Schwenckia hirta is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands.
